summary.name: Cart Total Not Updating After Remove

originalFeedback.quote: I removed an item from my cart but the total price still shows the old amount. I had to refresh the page to see the correct total.

problem.statement: Cart total displays stale value after removing items until page refresh
problem.expectedBehavior: Cart total updates immediately when items are removed
problem.actualBehavior: Cart total remains unchanged after item removal; only updates on page refresh

steps: Click remove button on any item
reproduction.minimumRepro: Remove any item from cart with 2+ items

rootCause.conclusion: Stale closure: useMemo in CartSummary has incorrect dependency array - missing 'items' causes total to be cached with old values

blastRadius.description: Similar memoization pattern used in wishlist

fix.approach: Fix stale closure in useMemo by adding missing dependency, enable exhaustive-deps lint rule to prevent recurrence, and add defensive handling for empty/null cart state

findings: Consistency: Cart total could also go stale if items are modified by another tab/session — fix should force recalculation on cart mount, not just on dependency change
Empty: When all items are removed, total should show $0.00 not blank/NaN — need null guard in calculation
Loading: If cart data is still loading when component mounts, useMemo could calculate from incomplete items array — need loading state check before calculation

acceptanceCriteria: Cart total updates immediately when item removed
Cart total updates immediately when quantity changed
Cart total shows $0.00 when cart is empty (not blank or NaN)
Cart total recalculates correctly on mount (handles stale tab state)
Cart total is not calculated during loading state (prevents partial data)
exhaustive-deps lint rule enabled and passing
Unit test for total recalculation on item change, empty cart, and loading state

learnings.patternToAvoid: Manually specifying useMemo dependencies without exhaustive-deps lint rule
learnings.patternToUse: Enable react-hooks/exhaustive-deps ESLint rule and trust the linter
